page.title: 12TRANSPORT
page.content: Wath has a very good bus service running to the main towns in the area.The car is still the main form of transport and because of the build up in{motor vehicles}a new{by-pass}is being built.This will cut down congestion in the town centre and the Montgomery roundabout. The new road is being built to the north of the town on the site of an old disused canal.The cost will be around Â£1.2m.The road is 1.2km long and 7.3 metres wide.Because it is being built on the old canal some of the ground was boggy,so a layer of rock had to be laid down to form a firm foundation for the road. Several old properties had to be demolished,and an old bridge to make way for the road.
